content: page 1 of 7 this little cardigan is designed for those first few months where babies are at their newest they are growing pretty fast and clothing is outgrown so quickly a wrap style opening to this garment means that chest size is adjustable going from a tiny 16 inches to a plump 19 inches approximately newborn to 6 months your babe will outgrow the sleeves before anything else ~~© cathy rubin 2012 australia~~ page 2 of 7 materials  4mm needle  cable needle optional  100yards 8ply yarn see below for ideas  tapestry needle and waste yarn  2 beads or pom poms for ties optional  6 stitch markers  4mm crochet hook suggested yarns  pear tree super-soft 8ply blue cabled version  red riding hood belle 8ply  bendigo luxury 8ply  woolganic knitter s yarn 8ply striped version  little plum yarns superwash merino 8ply pattern abbreviations k knit 1 stitch p purl 1 stitch m1 create new stitch by picking up the bar in the middle of your if using a stripe pattern stitches with your left needle and knit it creating a new stitch throughout the cardigan make see reference chapter sm slip marker from left needle to right needle sure your colour changes are on the wrong side purl row rs right side of knitting of your knitting ws wrong side of knitting kfab knit into the front and the back of the same stitch if omitting the cable please take gauge/gauge 20stitches and 24
